Gothic architecture is an architectural style that flourished in Europe during the High and Late Middle Ages. It is characterized by its pointed arches, ribbed vaults, and flying buttresses, as well as its ornate window tracery and sculptural details.

Gothic architecture is a style of architecture that flourished in Europe during the High and Late Middle Ages. It is characterized by its use of pointed arches, ribbed vaults, and flying buttresses, as well as its ornate and intricate decorative schemes.
